byline.contributor: Yufan Huang, Adam Wu and Mia Li contributed research.

abstract: Chinese authorities are struggling to contain public distrust and anger over unexplained chemical explosions in Tianjin; people are worried over toxins that were released during accident that killed at least 114 people and injured more than 700.
lead_paragraph: The government has insisted that it ensured the safety of the city’s air, but after rain on Tuesday, the streets began to foam.

headline.main: Fear of Toxic Air and Distrust of Government Follow Tianjin Blasts
headline.print_headline: Fear of Toxic Air and Distrust of Government Follow Explosions in China

snippet: The government has insisted that it ensured the safety of the city’s air, but after rain on Tuesday, the streets began to foam.
